thread.title: Lil Wayne Appreciates Rick Ross' Message Of Support In Birdman Beef
thread.title_full: Lil Wayne Appreciates Rick Ross' Message Of Support In Birdman Beef

author: Shaun M
title: Lil Wayne Appreciates Rick Ross' Message Of Support In Birdman Beef
text:
Home > Music > Lil Wayne Appreciates Rick Ross' Message Of Support In Birdman Beef Lil Wayne Appreciates Rick Ross' Message Of Support In Birdman Beef 30 1 Posted by Shaun M , Mar 16, 2017 at 04:03pm Rick Ross support for Lil Wayne was greatly appreciated. 
Thursday, after the international release of "Idols Become Rivals" -- his savage Birdman diss -- Rick Ross took to social media to express support from his embattled homie Lil Wayne . A post shared by The Boss Rick Ross,Yung Renzel (@richforever) on Mar 16, 2017 at 9:57am PDT 
It seems the message did not go unnoticed because Weezy thanked Rozay for standing shoulder to shoulder with him. dam big bro that msg hit me in the heart and put the motivation on automatik start. I needed that. 1 boss 2 another pic.twitter.com/3AIaHMuAmn — Lil Wayne WEEZY F (@LilTunechi) March 16, 2017 
On the Birdman diss record, Ross spits that he came to be disgusted by someone he felt so much respect for when he was coming up in the game. According to Yung Renzel, the way the Cash Money CEO exploited his artists is unforgivable. 
Though Birdman has stated several times that Tha Carter V is still up for a 2017 release, Lil Tunechi fans are still in the dark as to when it'll drop. The former friends are mired in a legal battle that has blocked the completed album's distribution. < class="robots-nocontent" rel=""> Mar 16, 2017 at 04:03pm 8.6K Views 
A chance to experience South By Southwest without actually being there. Rick Ross support for Lil Wayne was greatly appreciated. 
Thursday, after the international release of "Idols Become Rivals" -- his savage Birdman diss -- Rick Ross took to social media to express support from his embattled homie Lil Wayne . A post shared by The Boss Rick Ross,Yung Renzel (@richforever) on Mar 16, 2017 at 9:57am PDT 
It seems the message did not go unnoticed because Weezy thanked Rozay for standing shoulder to shoulder with him. dam big bro that msg hit me in the heart and put the motivation on automatik start. I needed that. 1 boss 2 another pic.twitter.com/3AIaHMuAmn — Lil Wayne WEEZY F (@LilTunechi) March 16, 2017 
On the Birdman diss record, Ross spits that he came to be disgusted by someone he felt so much respect for when he was coming up in the game. According to Yung Renzel, the way the Cash Money CEO exploited his artists is unforgivable. 
Though Birdman has stated several times that Tha Carter V is still up for a 2017 release, Lil Tunechi fans are still in the dark as to when it'll drop. The former friends are mired in a legal battle that has blocked the completed album's distribution.
